CatDescriptText: Mr. James M. Bissell, 3338 McNeil Place, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 25, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that business and employment are as good as the Eisenhower administration declares that it is?" answer reads: "Well, no, they aren't. But you can't blame the Eisenhower administration for it.  The reason, in my opinion, is because of automation, which is forced onto big business by the demands of the unions.  The Eisenhower administration is not to blame for it any more than the Truman administration.  When the overhead of the businesses is increased by union demands, that cuts the profits and in order to make profits, the businesses put in automation."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James M. Bissell wearing hat, plaid shirt, and dark cardigan sweater with top button unfastened, standing on sidewalk in front of brick building with sign that reads "Y... ...EN FO..."
